The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim was made in a Facebook post by the page "Okpanku Observer," which has a history of promoting content aimed at discrediting the government. This aspect helps verify the authenticity of the claim by considering the credibility and motive of the source.
Timing and context: The expert's verdict states that the post emerged shortly after the disbandment of the Special Anti-Robbery Squad (SARS) and its replacement with a new unit called Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT). This aspect helps verify the authenticity of the claim by considering the relevance and timing of the image in relation to the ongoing protests against police brutality.
Social media user reactions: The expert's verdict mentions that many comments on the post indicate that social media users believed the picture was taken recently in connection with the protests in Nigeria. This aspect helps verify the authenticity of the claim by considering the perception and interpretation of the image by the online community.
Location and image analysis: The expert's verdict reveals that the location of the photograph was traced to Ojota, Lagos, using physical features in the image and Google Maps Street View. Additionally, a Google reverse image search found that the image was documented by an AFP photojournalist in 2012. This aspect helps verify the authenticity of the claim by analyzing the location, consistency of details, and the credibility of the image source.
